{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2991314,"name":"Amalan Iyengar","username":"akiyengar","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ecd19e/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T04:04:31.986Z","cooked":"

I am trying to get the 2022 sysid tool working on a Romi and am running into issues following the instructions for the Romi from the WPILIB docs. I have my NT client attempting to localhost as well, config shown below:

image1270×762 78 KB

I have my Romi connected in bridge mode on my local network and changed the IP address to the Romi’s local address. When I hit “deploy” nothing happens. Should I be deploying the drivetrain characterization code from the sysid repo first?

Any help would be much appreciated

Currently SysID is an unsupported platform for the Romi. See this issue.

Daltz3:

Currently SysID is an unsupported platform for the Romi.

If Romi is not supported, why does SysID have an option for Romi under Analysis Type??

We have implemented the necessary logging code in our main (java) robot code. I haven’t tried it with the Romi but I use it all the time when running our robot in simulation. It consists of a couple of commands as well as three SysId logging classes. I just now updated our public 2022-beta repo with the latest changes. You might need to tweak the commands or your motor output code a bit to get it to work but you’re welcome to try it. The repo is here:
git clone git@bitbucket.org:sciborgs4061/java-robot-2022-beta-public.git
You then ignore the Generator part of the SysId and just use the Logger and Analyzer portions.

I should add that we designed our encoder-reading functions so that they all return in units of meters (i.e. all gearing, counts per revolution information, etc. is accounted for in the robot code so the units to choose in SysId are Unit Type=Meters and UnitsPerRotation=1.0)

In case anyone else is looking for this code/repo… ssh style clone didn’t work for me. I found the repo here: https://bitbucket.org/sciborgs4061/java-robot-2022-beta-public/src/main/
and used https style url to clone it:
git clone https://bitbucket.org/sciborgs4061/java-robot-2022-beta-public.git
